bioghist.p: Jean Kane Foulke (1891-1985) married E. Paul du Pont in 1910. She was a social rights activist and active in the women's suffrage movement. Her aunt, Florence Bayard Kane (1868-1943), was a Philadelphia volunteer worker and much-traveled individual who briefly worked as a librarian and as a processor of manuscripts.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of theatrical ephemera and other items from the collection of J. K. F. Du Pont's aunt, Florence Bayard Kane, donated in 1968. Materials include: programs and ephemera from Paris in 1899-1900, including programs for the Folies Bergere, the Sarah Bernhardt Theater, the Comedie Francaise, and the Theatre de l'Odeon; several calendars for 1900, and programs and souvenir books for plays in Boston and Philadelphia; a Cycling in Europe handbook, 1899; an article on the excavations in Kavousi, Crete; and a 1929 issue of La Petite Illustration, which includes two plays.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
